content:
been working on small illustrations to supplement the for/ pages. would appreciate feedback-- do you think there needs to be more of them? do you have ideas for any specific bullet points?
example.gif
I think that's about the right number of them; I think we may want to think more about what the precise ideas we want to get across are; I'm not super I get the lemonade stand, for example.

there's also the possibility of using the more theme-general illustrations such as "holiday" (postcard, polaroids) or "portrait" (different fish pictures framed) ones but i guess if a page has most of its illustrations be relevant we can't just have one that's out of theme. turns out i put the lemonade illustration at the wrong location-- its supposed to be in the "working groups and communities" part!

The lemonade stand is supposed to get across that it's really cheap / at a discount for most working groups and communities.
The lock and key one is also for a different page; it goes with easy authentication on the for/companies page.

Our algorithm for these pages has been to just choose 2-3 points that are salient enough that we'll always want to get them across (no matter how our landing pages evolve), and use those to inspire cute illustrations.

One thing that may or may not work with the need to keep third-party logos non-modified would be to have something where the GitHub Octocat is hanging out with our octopus/other sea creatures, conveying the "plays nice with GitHub, both from an auth standpoint and an integrations standpoint" message
that's a good idea! however i feel like we 'd have a problem in terms of the octocat needing to be kept as-is, while the illustrations have a specific colour palette-- might be jarring?

According to https://github.com/logos:

(Please don't) Change the colors, dimensions or add your own text/images

thanks for finding this-- changing our visual style to be more colourful wouldn't be a solution, either. doing a slight reference to GitHub can also not be understood by some users (eg. this illustration) opensource.png. i think we should perhaps not have a company reference at all.
Yeah, it seems like any modification or integration of the Octocat with other images is unallowed :/
I do really like that rendition of the Octocat :) Though we shouldn't use it.
it's far enough from octocat that it's probably okay to use, but i do think it makes it a bit obscure.

here's what the three pages look like now! ping @Rishi Gupta
example.gif
example.gif

cool, these are looking great! Minor comments:

  • community picture (circle): discussed offline. It's possible this page is small enough that we don't actually need a second image, even?
  • lemonade stand: looking in context, maybe remove the ! from the whale, and lower the height of the upper bar? If it's possible to have a character in back I think that would be ideal, but I can see how that's tough in terms of it getting too noisy.
  • Scale to 1000s: this picture seems bigger than the rest, so maybe just a bit smaller?
  • corporate lock and key: I think you meant the other lock and key image here (the one with the bigger lock and smaller key)?

open-source scale image is smaller:
pasted image
corporate lock is bigger:
pasted image
removed the first image for working communities, i think it's enough to have one image.
example.gif
